content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

content:
well, you can do a search for date, then highlight the results and move to a separate folder Then, you can use the importexporttools NG addon to export as an mbox and import as mbox on the other drive OR, you can exit thunderbird after creating the folder and copy from the profile and, after switching to new drive to paste into the profile there. I suggest using the Mail\Local Folders folder.

Those are the basics, but if you need more detail, let me know. They can also be merged into an existing folder, but that's more detail and can get a bit messy, but does work ok for POP.

content: Each message folder is in two parts, such as inbox, inbox.msf, sent, sent.msf. After you do the search and save to a folder, you want to export the folder itself, not individual emails. They will be in the folder. you can ignore copying the msf entries.

content:
What is the outgoing configuration?

Do you setting match those published by Yahoo https://help.yahoo.com/kb/pop-access-settings-instructions-yahoo-mail-sln4724.html?guccounter=1

They appear to be Outgoing Mail (SMTP) Server 

   Server - smtp.mail.yahoo.com    Port - 465 or 587    Requires SSL - Yes    Requires TLS - Yes (if available)    Requires authentication - Yes

What is not mentioned is authentication method and this should be OAuth2. If you need to change the server name you have to close the account settings tab and reopen it to reset the list of available authentication methods as OAuth2 is only offered as an option for a limited number of pre-approved server names.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Tools>Export for Mobile should do it.
creator: davidsk

content: Please describe the problem in detail and someone may have suggestions. Thank you. Please include any error messages in English.
creator: davidsk

content:
There is a standard block of text approved for use when folks jump in on someone elses support topics. It goes. "If the above information does not resolve your issue, you should consider creating a new thread with specific details about your issue." you might consider it rude, but it is an integral part of the way these forums are structured.

The rules and guidelines state.

Do not re-use existing threads started by others, even if they are seemingly on the same subject. Ask a new question instead.
Asked for password to send message from Yahoo account,,, but do not acept the password

That usually means you are using the wrong server settings. Yahoo uses oAuth2 authentication for both incoming and outgoing mail. Those requests to authenticate using oAuth2 are mostly full webpage requests, not the more traditional tiny password requests dialogs which I feel you are probably referring to, although I am left guessing as you do not describe what you do or what the request looks like. I have even seen loads of people in these forums lamenting these oAuth "popups" and asking how to stop them, apparently unaware they are even a password request. Of course Yahoo do not help the cause by using a link that does not contain yahoo in it so folks think is is a scam. But they are the ones choosing to use Yahoo.

This topic https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1539853 has a link to what a yahoo oAuth2 signin page looks like. Is that what you are getting? If not your settings are to say the least most suspect.

If it looks like the one at 5 in this link your settings are certainly wrong.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: On the new Mac open the Activity Monitor and verify if any Thunderbird application is running. Or click on the Apple symbol in the upper left corner in the menu bar and select "Force quit"

content:
App is not running. App is not in the force quit menu.

I found a workaround by trashing the whole "thunderbird" folder from the User>Library, relaunching the app and then going to Tools> Import to import my old thunderbird profile folder. Sprouted a few grey hairs in the process of figuring this all out but at least my new computer has all my emails now.
